intro: Sphaerostigma utahense, commonly known as the Utah spurge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
